sections.MISSION:
Bull Troop conducts M4/M249 Tables 6 and ARM IVO RNG 101 NLT 07 2359 DEC2024 IOT qualify all soldiers on weapons in preparation for SQDLFX and collective training
Bull Thunder M4/M249 RNG 101
COMMANDERS
sections.PURPOSE: Prepare Troop for SQD LFX and further collective training
sections.END STATE:
100 Bull Troopers Qualified in M4 and 40 M249, No casualties
TRAINING OBJECTIVES:
Bull Troopers can accurately and quickly engage the enemy using the M4 Carbine
Bull Troopers can accurately and quickly engage the enemy using the M249 Automatic Rifle
Concurrent Task 3
sections.CONCEPT OF OPERATION:
Planning: LT Smith plan and resources backside support for the range, RSO plans the training in accordance with IWITS strategy
Preparation: On 19NOV RSO back briefs CPT Johnson the training plan during rehearsal and SL’s train the trainer (TL’s) at the range
sections.EXECUTION:
Rifle Teams conduct Table 6 Qual and Advanced Rifle Marksmanship training in accordance with IWTS
Recovery: Participants collect ammo and clean the range. Range is closed out.
sections.TASKS:
TO SUBS:
SSG Kuchesvsky creates training CONOP NLT 15NOV2024
SSG Kuchevsky Rehearses Range plan NLT 19NOV2024 IOT coordinate resources and train the trainer
CORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
Rehersal of Concept 26NOV (With Dakota)
sections.COMMAND AND SIGNAL:
P: TSM Radios
A: FM Radios
C: Runner
E: Signal
OIC: LT Chamblee
RSO: SSG Kuchevsky Range Control DSN: 599-1200
N
GTA
RNG 101

draw.overall_supervision_plan:
1 ratio. OIC and RSO will continuously monitor all aspects of the Qualification. Newly Identified risks will be 
recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be improved at the appropriate level. Every Soldier will be considered a safety, 
if they see an unsafe act they will call a cease fire and notify everyone to stop training. The range has an RSO and constant access to the 
range tower radio and telephone to contact the Range Control Firing Desk and 7ATC as appropriate. In the event of a real word MEDEVAC 
event on site, Safeties and Training Support Personnel are responsible for ceasing fire on the range and communication directly with the OIC/
RSO of the range to coordinate MEDEVAC. 
I assess the initial risk of this event to be of critical severity with seldom probability, but with mitigation efforts I assess the residual risk of 
this event to be critical severity of unlikely probability.
